K.1.title: Count forward and backward
K.1.description: The student will count forward orally by ones to 100, count backward orally by ones from 20, and count by tens to 100, beginning with any multiple of ten.

K.2.title: Count objects up to 20
K.2.description: The student will count forward by ones to at least 31 and count a set of objects up to 20.

1.1.title: Count objects and write numerals
1.1.description: The student will count forward orally by ones to 110, count by fives and tens to 100, and write the numerals 0 through 110.

1.2.title: Add and subtract whole numbers
1.2.description: The student will recall basic addition facts with sums to 18 or less and the corresponding subtraction facts.

2.1.title: Read and write numerals
2.1.description: The student will read, write, and identify the place value of each digit in a three-digit numeral, using concrete materials.

2.2.title: Compare and order whole numbers
2.2.description: The student will compare two whole numbers between 0 and 999, using symbols (>, <, =) and words (greater than, less than, equal to).

3.1.title: Read and represent whole numbers through 9,999
3.1.description: The student will read and write six-digit whole numbers and identify the place value and value of each digit.

3.2.title: Compare and order whole numbers through 9,999
3.2.description: The student will compare and order whole numbers through 9,999, using the symbols <, >, and =.

3.3.title: Identify and represent equivalent forms of fractions
3.3.description: The student will identify and represent fractions and mixed numbers with denominators through 12.

3.4.title: Add and subtract whole numbers
3.4.description: The student will estimate sums and differences of whole numbers and add and subtract whole numbers, with and without regrouping.

K.1.title: Scientific investigation and reasoning skills
K.1.description: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations.

1.1.title: Scientific investigation and reasoning skills
1.1.description: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations.

K.1.title: Oral language
K.1.description: The student will demonstrate growth in oral early literacy skills.

1.1.title: Oral language
1.1.description: The student will continue to demonstrate growth in oral early literacy skills.
